security.paillier

Class PaillierCipher

  • Object
    • CipherSpi
      • PaillierCipher

  • public final class PaillierCipher
extends CipherSpi
    Author:
    Andrew Quijano This class contains the Paillier cipher that supports Paillier operations on BigIntegers. As it extends from CipherSpi, it can also encrypt byte arrays as well.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PaillierCipher()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static BigInteger add_plaintext(BigInteger ciphertext, BigInteger plaintext, PaillierPublicKey pk)
      returns the sum of the Paillier encrypted evidence and plaintext value Note: The result is still encrypted Warning: If the sum exceeds N, it gets modded by N

      static BigInteger add(BigInteger ciphertext1, BigInteger ciphertext2, PaillierPublicKey pk)

      • encrypt

        public static BigInteger encrypt(BigInteger plaintext,
                                 PaillierPublicKey pk)
                          throws HomomorphicException
        Compute ciphertext = g^{m}r^{n} (mod n^2)
        Parameters:
        plaintext -
        pk -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        HomomorphicException - - If the plaintext is larger than the plaintext supported by Paillier Public Key, an exception will be thrown

        sk -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        HomomorphicException - - If the ciphertext is larger then the N^2, an exception will be thrown

      • divide

        public static BigInteger divide(BigInteger ciphertext,
                                long divisor,
                                PaillierPublicKey pk)
        Compute the division of the Paillier cipher-text and a plaintext. Warning: Divide will only work correctly on perfect divisor like 2|20, it will work. If you try 3|20, it will NOT work and you will get a wrong answer! If you want to do 3|20, you MUST use a division protocol from Veugen paper
        Parameters:
        ciphertext -
        divisor -
        pk -
        Returns:

                                PaillierPublicKey pk)
